pyGMLMcuda¶

API for working with CUDA code for fast GPU computation with GMLMs (made with pybind11)

class pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructure¶

Bases: pybind11_builtins.pybind11_object

add_group(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructure, arg0: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup) → int¶

Adds the structure of a tensor group of coefficients. Note: the trials will need to be constructed with the groups in the same order.

Parameters

structure_group (ModelStructureGroup) – Object containing the group’s structure.

Returns

The group index of the added group (returns 0, 1, 2, … as groups are added)

Return type

group_index (int)

get_bin_size_sec(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructure) → float¶

Gets the bin size for this model.

Returns

the time bin size in seconds

Return type

bin_size_sec (float)

get_group(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructure, arg0: int) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup¶

Gets the structure for a tensor parameter group.

Parameters

group_index (int) – values 0 to get_num_groups()-1. The group requested.

Returns

the group

Return type

structure_group (ModelStructureGroup)

Raises

ValueError – if group_index is invalid

Gets the type of likelihood for this model.

Returns

the type of log likelihood being used.

Return type

log_like_type (pyGMLMcuda.logLikeType)

Returns

size_t): number of groups

Return type

dim_J (unsigned int64

size_t): the number of linear parameters (same for each neuron)

Return type

Returns

size_t): number of neurons

Return type

dim_P (unsigned int64

is_simultaneous_recording(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructure) → bool¶

If is simultaneous recording or not.

Returns

If true, data is organized as a simultaneous recording.

If false, each trial holds data for one cell at a time.

Return type

simultaneous_recording (bool)

get_factor_dim(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup, arg0: int) → int¶

Parameters

factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

Returns

size_t): is 0 if factor_index is invalid

Return type

dim_F[factor_index] (unsigned int64

get_mode_dim(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup, arg0: int) → int¶

Gets the specified size for a given mode.

Parameters

factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

Returns

size_t): is 0 if factor_index is invalid

Return type

dim_F[factor_index] (unsigned int64

get_mode_parts(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup) → List[int]¶

Gets this list of which part each mode belongs to;

Returns

unsigned ints): [dim_J] the factors which each mode belongs to. The list should start at 0 and be ascending by increments of at most 1
e.g., if mode_dimensions = [6,5,8] and mode_parts = [0, 0, 1]

We have 2 factors, one containing modes 0 and 1 (of dim_F[0] = 6*5 = 30) and a second factor (of dim_F[1] = 8)

Return type

mode_parts (list

get_num_factors(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup) → int¶

Gets the number of factors specified

Returns

size_t): The number of factors. dim_D <= get_num_modes()

Return type

dim_D (unsigned int64

get_num_modes(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup) → int¶

Gets the number of modes specified

Returns

size_t): The number of factors. dim_J >= get_num_factors()

Return type

dim_J (unsigned int64

get_shared_regressor(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup, arg0: int) → numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]¶

For a shared regressor, returns the coefficient.

Parameters

factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

Returns

[dim_X_shared x dim_F[factor_index]] the shared regressors

Return type

X_shared (np.ndarray)

Raises

ValueError – if factor_index is invalid or if the size of X_shared is invalid (wrong width)

get_shared_regressor_dim(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup, arg0: int) → int¶

For a shared regressor, returns the number of rows in the design matrix.

Parameters

factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

Returns

size_t): is 0 if factor_index is invalid or if !isSharedRegressor(facotrIndex)

Return type

dim_X_shared[factor_index] (unsigned int64

is_shared_regressor(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup, arg0: int) → bool¶

Finds out if a mode has been assigned a shared regressor with the setSharedRegressors() method.

Parameters

factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

Returns

True if a shared regressor has been specified.

Return type

is_shared (bool)

Raises

ValueError – if factor_index is invalid or if the size of X_shared is invalid (wrong width)

set_shared_regressors(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructureGroup, arg0: int, arg1: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]) → None¶

Sets a ‘shared regressor’ for a factor. Shared regressors allow more efficient use of regressors that are repeated across a lot of time bins. Each trial defines its regressors only as indices into this shared regressor matrix.

Parameters

  • factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

  • X_shared (np.ndarray) – [dim_X_shared x dim_F[factor_index]] the shared regressors

Raises

ValueError – if factor_index is invalid or if the size of X_shared is invalid (wrong width)

Gets the neuron-wise linear parameter (B).

Returns

[dim_B x neurons] where dim_B is the dimension of the linear term.

Return type

B (numpy.ndarray)

The constant terms [neurons x 1]

Return type

W (numpy.ndarray)

Parameters

Raises

ValueError – if the sizes of the arguments do not match expected dimensions

set_W(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Parameters, arg0: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]) → None¶

Sets the neuron-wise baseline firing rate parameter (W).

Parameters

W (numpy.ndarray) – The constant terms [neurons x 1]

Raises

ValueError – if the sizes of the arguments do not match expected dimensions

set_linear_params(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Parameters, arg0: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64], arg1: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]) → None¶

Sets both the of the neuron-wise constant/baseline firing rate parameter (W) and the neuron-wise linear parameter (B).

Parameters

  • W (numpy.ndarray) – The constant terms [neurons x 1]

  • B (numpy.ndarray) – [dim_B x neurons] where dim_B is the dimension of the linear term.

Raises

ValueError – if the sizes of the arguments do not match expected dimensions

Parameters

set_rank(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ParametersGroup, arg0: int) → None¶

Changes the rank of the tensor group.

Parameters

int64 (dim_R (unsigned) – size_t): the rank. Should be 0 <= dim_R <= structure_group.dim_R_max;

Raises

ValueError – if dim_R is invalid (e.g., too large for pre-allocated space)

If the model is for individually recorded neurons, is [trials x 1]

class pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial¶

Bases: pybind11_builtins.pybind11_object

add_group(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial, arg0: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup) → int¶

Adds a tensor group of coefficients. Note: all trials will need to be built by adding the groups in the same order - currently they can’t be reordered. The order must match how the corresponding ModelStructureGroup was built.

Parameters

trial_group (TrialGroup) – Object containing the group’s coefficients. Size of group’s coefficients (N) must match the trial length (N)

Returns

The group index of the added group (returns 0, 1, 2, … as groups are added)

Return type

group_index (int)

get_dim_N(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial) → int¶

Gets the trial length.

Parameters

64 (N (unsigned int) – size_t): The trial’s length / number of time bins.

get_group(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial, arg0: int) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup¶

Gets a tensor group of coefficients.

Parameters

group_idx (int) – the index of the tensor group

Returns

Object containing the group’s coefficients. Size of group’s coefficients (N) must match the trial length (N)

Return type

trial_group (TensorGroup)

Raises

ValueError – if group number is invalid

get_linear_coefficients(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial) → numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]¶

Gets the linear coefficients for the trial.

Returns

[N x B x (P or 1)] the linear coefficients for this trial. They can be unique for each neuron (3rd dim is size P) or the same (3rd dim is size 1 or X_lin is only 2D)

Return type

X_lin (numpy.ndarray)

get_neuron_num(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial) → int¶

Gets the neuron index (for non-simultaneous data)

Returns

The trial’s neuron idx (will be -1, an invalid value, for simultaneous population data)

Return type

(int)

get_num_groups(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial) → int¶

Gets the number of tensor parameter groups That have been added to this trial.

Returns

The number of groups.

Return type

dim_J (unsigned int)

get_observations(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial) → numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]¶

Gets the observations for the trial.

Returns

[N x P] the spike observations where N is the trial length and P is the number of neurons.

Return type

Y (numpy.ndarray)

get_trial_num(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Trial) → int¶

Gets the trial index

Returns

The trial’s index

Return type

(int)

class pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup¶

Bases: pybind11_builtins.pybind11_object

add_local_factor(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup, arg0: numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]) → int¶

Adds a factor of coefficients. The linear term for this type of factor is dense. Note: all trials will need to be built by adding the factors in the same order - currently they can’t be reordered. The order must match how the corresponding ModelStructureGroup was built.

Each factor can have a tensor decomposition in the ModelStructureGroup structure (hence the usage of factor vs. mode here and the results+params structure). The size of the factor (dim_F) is the product of the size of the modes that contribute to the factor (the dim_Ts).

Parameters

X (np.ndarray) – [N x dim_F x (dim_A or 1)] coefficients for a multilinear mode. The third dim is the number of ‘events’ - if it is 1, then the linear term is the same for all events. (Or only one event is used)

Returns

The index of the added factor (returns 0, 1, 2, … as factors are added)

Return type

factor_index (int)

add_shared_idx_factor(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup, arg0: numpy.ndarray[numpy.int32]) → int¶

Adds a factor of coefficients. The linear term for this type of factor is has a sparse structure. The coefficients are contained in a ModelStructureGroup object - set by ModelStructureGroup.set_shared_regressors(). This strcture only needs the indices into the rows of that object, Note: all trials will need to be built by adding the factors in the same order - currently they can’t be reordered. The order must match how the corresponded ModelStructureGroup was built.

Each factor can have a tensor decomposition in the ModelStructureGroup structure (hence the usage of factor vs. mode here and the results+params structure). The size of the factor (dim_F) is the product of the size of the modes that contribute to the factor (the dim_Ts).

Parameters

iX (np.ndarray of ints) – [N x (dim_A or 1)] indices into the rows of the corresponding shared_regressor from the kcGMLM_modelStructure_tensorGroup object. Entries that are negative or larger than the shared_regressor array are treated as 0’s. The second dim is the number of ‘events’ - if it is 1, then the linear term is the same for all events. (Or only one event is used)

Returns

The index of the added factor (returns 0, 1, 2, … as factors are added)

Return type

factor_index (int)

get_dim_N(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup) → int¶

Gets the number of timebins in the trial given the coefficients.

Returns

size_t): is 0 if the setup is invalid/inconsistent

Return type

dim_N (unsigned int64

get_factor_dim(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup, arg0: int) → int¶

Gets the dimensions of a factor.

Parameters

factor_index (int) – the index of the factor (0, …, get_num_factors()-1)

Returns

size_t): is 0 if factor_index is invalid

Return type

dim_F[factor_index] (unsigned int64

get_local_factor(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup, arg0: int) → numpy.ndarray[numpy.float64]¶

Gets local coefficients for a factor

Parameters

factor_index (int) – The index of the factor

Returns

[N x dim_F x (dim_A or 1)] coefficients for a multilinear mode.

The third dim is the number of ‘events’ - if it is 1, then the linear term is the same for all events. (Or only one event is used)

Return type

X (np.ndarray)

Raises

ValueError if factor_index is invalid –

get_num_factors(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup) → int¶

Gets the number of timebins in the trial given the coefficienbts.

Returns

size_t): the number of factors that have been added so far.

Return type

dim_D (unsigned int64

get_shared_idx_factor(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup, arg0: int) → numpy.ndarray[numpy.int32]¶

Gets shared coefficient indicies for a facotr

Parameters

factor_index (int) – The index of the factor

Returns

[N x (dim_A or 1)] indices into the rows of the corresponding shared_regressor from the kcGMLM_modelStructure_tensorGroup object.

Entries that are negative or larger than the shared_regressor array are treated as 0’s. The second dim is the number of ‘events’ - if it is 1, then the linear term is the same for all events. (Or only one event is used)

Return type

iX (np.ndarray of ints)

Raises

ValueError if factor_index is invalid –

valid_dim_A(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialGroup, arg0: int) → bool¶

If a number of “events” is valid for the coefficient structure provided.

Parameters

dim_A (int) – number of events

Returns

True if valid, False if inconsistent with coefficient setup.

Return type

bool

class pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM¶

Bases: pybind11_builtins.pybind11_object

add_block(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM, arg0: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialBlock) → int¶

Adds a block of trials to the current GMLM object. Note: calls freeGPU() if data has been sent to the GPU already.

Parameters

block (TrialBlock) – A set of trials to be placed on a single GPU.

Returns

Index of the block that was just added (will go 0, 1, 2, … as blocks are added)

Return type

block index (int)

Raises

ValueError – if trials in block do not match expected GMLM structure

compute_log_likelihood(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM, arg0: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Parameters) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Results¶

Computes the log likelihood (and gradients if setComputeGradient(true) has been called)

Parameters

params (Parameters) – Object containing all the model parameters

Returns

Object containing all the results

Return type

results (Results)

compute_log_likelihood_async(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM, arg0: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Parameters) → None¶

Send a call to the GPU to compute the log likelihood (and gradients if setComputeGradient(true) has been called). Returns before the computation has finished so that it can be collected later by the get_results() method.

Parameters

params (Parameters) – Object containing all the model parameters

freeGPU(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → None¶

Frees all values loaded to the GPU(s).

get_GMLM_structure(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.ModelStructure¶

Gets the structure object for this GMLM.

Returns

SHARED object

Return type

structure (ModelStructure)

get_block(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM, arg0: int) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.TrialBlock¶

Gets a blocks of trials to the current GMLM object.

Parameters

block (int) – index of the block

Returns

array of TrialBlock

Raises

ValueError – if block index is invalid

get_num_blocks(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → int¶

Gets the number of blocks loaded to the GMLM.

Returns

(int) number of blocks

get_params(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Parameters¶

Gets the parameter object for this GMLM. The parameters are a shared object - getting this object and modifying the values will change parameters for the next log likelihood call.

Returns

SHARED object

Return type

params (Parameters)

get_results(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Results¶

Collects the last computed log likelihood results. This can be called after compute_log_likelihood_async()

Returns

Object containing all the results

Return type

results (Results

get_results_struct(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.Results¶

Gets the full results structure that has been set up for this GMLM. Values may be invalid.

Returns

Object containing all the results.

Return type

results (Results)

is_on_GPU(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → bool¶

If the variables are loaded to the GPU or not.

Returns

(bool) True or false if on GPU(s).

set_compute_gradient(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM, arg0: bool) → None¶

Sets whether or not to compute the gradient.

Parameters

gradOn (bool) – True if gradient should be computed, False otherwise.

toGPU(self: pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.kcGMLM) → None¶

Loads all the trial blocks that have been added to the GPU.

class pyGMLM.pyGMLMcuda.logLikeType¶

Bases: pybind11_builtins.pybind11_object

The types of log likelihod that are allowed.

Members:

ll_poiss_exp : Standard Poisson likelihood with exponential inverse link function

ll_squared_error : Squared error

ll_truncpoiss_exp : Truncated Poisson: sums mass over all positive values (for data with spike/no spike in bins).

ll_poiss_softplus : Poisson likelihood with softplus inverse link function
